display_title.display_title:
The development objective of the
            Burkina Faso, Chad, Mali, Mauritania, Niger, Senegal, and
            The Gambia - Africa Emergency Locust Project is to reduce
            the vulnerability of the concerned countries to '
            future desert locust infestations by supporting improved
            strategies for prevention, early warning systems, reactions,
            and mitigation at both the national and regional levels. The
            environmental assessment (EA) evaluated impact which include
            : locust treatment campaigns; inventories and use of
            pesticides; rodents; public health; wild life, animals;
            vegetation; surface and ground water; agriculture
            investments; job creation. As a result of this assessment
            the EA's mitigation measures include : adopt measures
            to protect human health and the environment during desert
            locusts treatment campaigns; destruction of obsolete
            pesticides stocks; proper disposal of empty containers;
            early warning and response consisting of reinforcement of
            the institutional capacity of crop protection agencies;
            development of an integrated management plan for elimination
            of predators, and proper use of pesticides; establish a
            network at the national level for the surveillance-alert of
            phytosanitary infestation; use of protective equipment for
            the workers handling/storing/applying pesticides; support
            the use of dusting planes; monitor quality of local
            production and imported pesticides; mobilize village
            brigades during critical periods, and finally, promote
            international collaborative efforts to prevent the
            re-occurrence of this (locust infestation) natural disaster.

            construction d’un magasin de stockage de pesticides à Dori
